content: @Sumana Harihareswara

That sounds awesome @Rohan B -- looking forward to seeing more of your work. We're currently working on https://zulip-ck.readthedocs.io/en/1754-docs-add-git-workflow/git-guide.html as a workflow guide in case you want to check that out.
Is the VMWare Fusion Vagrant plugin paid-only?
@Rohan B Oooh. I don't know. @Christie Koehler might.
(She wrote that guide, IIUC.)
alright.
@Rohan B An alternative might be: get a hosted VM at DigitalOcean or a similar host, something that will give you a cheap Debian or Ubuntu VM....
if you don't want to install the relevant dependencies on your personal computer
I'm 80% sure the plugin is free. It's been a while since I installed it, but I don't remember having to pay any money.
https://checkout.shopify.com/1739884/checkouts/6c7835f9fe7b683d353080e0c4d2bb56
following the links given in the docs
Huh, that's unfortunate. We should add that to the documentation, that it's not free.
correct me if I'm wrong, but the virtualbox is used to emulate a particular OS, in this case if I used my laptop which has ubuntu installed I won't require installation of the virtualbox
Oh, if you have ubuntu, you're set! Also, for OSX, the paid option is only if you want more speed--I have the free option, which is slower.
Alright, I guess I'll use my other laptop for zulip dev purposes then.

@Rohan B "Installing on Ubuntu 14.04 Trusty or 16.04 Xenial directly. This offers the most convenient developer experience, but is difficult to uninstall." From https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/dev-overview.html .
I am on OSX, but I have another laptop which has ubuntu linux installed on it.
my problem with the virtualbox on my mac is that I only have 128gb
ssd
I'll try it out, I hope it won't slow things down.
VM Ware Fusion for Vagrant is a paid plugin.
on both sides -- you have to pay for VM Ware Fusion and for the Vagrant plugin.
I haven't tested it.

The docs say:

Install VirtualBox or (for better performance; Virtualbox is quite slow) VMWare Fusion with the VMWare Fusion Vagrant plugin.

Isn't VirtualBox free?
Even on Ubuntu, I still recommend you do the vagrant install if you can. It doesn't take as many resources as on OS X or Windows because it uses Linux Containers instead of a virtual machine.
@Steve Howell Yes, VIrtualBox is free.
@Rohan B To develop on OS X you need to use some kind of virtualization. There is no method for installing directly.

We used to develop directly on OSX, but there are a lot more dependencies now, so it would be very ambitious and cumbersome to do it now, and of course you'd lose all the automation that provision.py provides you when you go the VM route.
Virtualbox is free, yes
